conversation.message: Dear School_E Admissions, I’m Student_E. I’m very interested in joining School_E and believe I would be a strong fit for your program and community. I would like to formally apply for your available seat and would be excited to commit if accepted. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but School_C’s priority list ranks me 4th (behind Student_B, Student_A, Student_D). Those higher-priority students are likely to apply to School_E first, so School_C may still be contested and I could be rejected. School_E, although last on my list, ranks me 1st, so applying there now secures a guaranteed match and avoids the risk of ending up unmatched if top schools fill. Given the one-seat capacities and competitive priorities at my higher choices, I will lock in School_E.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and your interest in School_E. We’re pleased to offer you admission to our available seat. We believe you would be a strong addition to our community and would be excited to welcome you to School_E.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions
conversation.thought: School_E has quota 1 and received APPLY messages from Students E, A, D, and B. On School_E’s true priority list, Student_E is ranked #1 (highest), followed by B, A, D, C. Since Student_E is applying now and is the top priority, accepting immediately secures the best possible match for School_E and avoids any risk of losing them to another school in later rounds. Therefore, accept Student_E.

conversation.message: Hello School_E Admissions Committee—I'm Student_A and I’m applying because School_E is my first-choice school. I’m highly motivated to contribute to the school community and would enthusiastically accept an offer if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_E, so I should pursue it immediately. Competition will be strong (Student_B and Student_D also rank School_E first, and School_E’s priority puts Student_B above me), but applying now is the only way to have any chance at my #1. I will make a clear, committed application emphasizing strong fit and that School_E is my first choice.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for naming School_E as your first choice. At this time, we have already filled our available seat and therefore cannot offer you admission.

We appreciate your interest in School_E and wish you the best in the remainder of the matching process.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions
conversation.thought: Quota is 0 and School_E is already matched with Student_E, who is #1 on our true priority list and has been accepted in the existing history. Per rules, with quota 0 we must reject any new [APPLY] messages regardless of the applicant’s rank. Student_A is ranked #3 on our list, but cannot be accommodated without breaking the established match and quota constraint.

conversation.message: Dear School_E Admissions, I’m Student_D and I’m formally applying. Applying now maximizes my chance to secure my first choice before capacity fills.
